required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 28 Day Parallel Group Study to Assess the Effects of RDN-929
clinical_study.official_title: A Parallel Group Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability and Pharmacokinetic (PK) Profile of Multiple Oral Doses of RDN-929 in Healthy Older Adults

brief_summary.textblock: Eligibility will be assessed during a screening period of up to 4 weeks. Subjects will take study medication once daily up to and including Day 28. Safety, tolerability and PK will be measured at each visit.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with adverse events
primary_outcome.description: Screening to end of study, up to 9 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Physical exam findings
primary_outcome.description: Screening to end of study, up to 9 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Clinical safety lab changes
primary_outcome.description: Screening to end of study, up to 9 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Systolic blood pressure changes
primary_outcome.description: Screening to end of study, up to 9 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with Heart rate changes
primary_outcome.description: Screening to end of study, up to 9 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Number of subjects with 12 Lead ECG changes
primary_outcome.description: Screening to end of study, up to 9 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the plasma and CSF concentration time curve, AUC

arm_group.description: low, medium and high dose of RDN-929 capsules

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult males or postmenopausal or surgically sterile females age 55 - 85 years old.
- Healthy as determined by the Investigator, based on a medical evaluation including medical history, physical examination, neurological examination, laboratory tests and ECG recording
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any history of major psychiatric disorders, including substance use disorders, according to the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, 5th Edition (DSM-5) criteria
- Alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) levels greater than 1.5 times the upper limit of normal (ULN)
- A clinically significant abnormality on physical examination, neurological examination, ECG, or laboratory evaluations
- A clinically significant vital signs abnormality, as judged by the principal investigator
